channel.title: Review on Tahir Hashmi
channel.description: Recent content in Review on Tahir Hashmi

item.title: D7100 and AF-P DX 70-300 VR on an Airshow
item.author: mail@tahirhashmi.com (Tahir Hashmi)
item.description: Aero India is a biennial air show that takes place on an airfield on the outskirts of Bangalore. As per Wikipedia, it’s the world’s largest air show after the one in Paris. I first came to know of it when a friend of mine armed with a Nikon D70s and a non-VR 70-300 f/4-5.6 came back with some fabulous shots way back in 2007. Ten years later, I got to visit the show with a Nikon D7100 and an AF-P DX 70-300mm f/4.

item.title: AF-S Nikkor 20mm ƒ/1.8G on DX
item.author: mail@tahirhashmi.com (Tahir Hashmi)
item.description: Early this year, I acquired a used 20mm ƒ/1.8G Nikkor lens. I only have DX bodies and the 20mm works more like a wide-normal prime than an ultra-wide, as on FX. 20mm ƒ/1.8G Nikkor on a D7100. It’s big. Why use 20mm ƒ/1.8G? on DX? I had long wanted to have a small, fast 24mm prime for my DX bodies. While the 35mm ƒ/1.8 DX is compact enough, I don’t like it that much.

item.title: Six Months with Nikon D7100
item.author: mail@tahirhashmi.com (Tahir Hashmi)
item.description: It’s been more than six months since I have had a Nikon D7100 for my own and I have been thinking of writing down my thoughts about the camera. However, these six months with the camera have been a bit of an up-and-down journey and it’s only now that I feel like I know the camera enough to write about it. The D7100 is an enthusiasts’ camera and it will make you earn that title before you can be get along with it.
